en:
For another representation of a mortal youth ("Polykles") with personifications, see
      <rs type="vase">London E 698</rs>.

A female figure, probably Peitho (seemingly labelled above her right
      arm, but now unreadable), standing profile to the right, with her left foot raised on a rock,
      bent at the waist, wearing a belted, sleeveless chiton, with shoulder straps, a rayed
      sphendone, two (red?) bands on her right wrist, arranges sprigs of vegetation with her right
      hand, on a flat basket/plate held in her left hand, and rests her left elbow on her knee;
      Aphrodite (labelled) seated 3/4-view to the left, with her head profile to the right, her
      calves crossed, wearing a himation around her legs and up her back, which she holds over her
      right shoulder in her right hand, over a belted, medium-sleeved chiton, and a rayed sphendone,
      rests her left hand on her seat; beneath her, a footed box with shoes atop; a nude winged
      Pothos (labelled on either side of his wings), leaning near profile to the right, with his
      weight on his right leg, his left leg relaxed, and crossing his right calf, rests his left
      elbow near the lap of Chryippos (labelled above his head), and points his right hand to the
      left, to Aphrodite; Chrysippos (mortal youth/bridegroom?), seated on his chlamys (?) 3/4-view
      to the left, with his legs crossed, wearing boots, a scabbard strap over his right shoulder,
      and a petasos behind his neck, holds his right hand on his knee, and his left hand at his
      side; a palmette beneath him; a faded kanoun; Pompe (labelled above her head), seated 3/4-view
      to the right, with her head turned profile to the left, wearing a short-sleeved, belted chiton
      with shoulder straps, a black band necklace, and a rayed sphendone, holds her right arm in
      front of her chest, her upraised left hand behind her head, and looks down to the left, at the
      kanoun.

<bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 7.435 s.v. Pompe no. 1, pl. 348 (E. Simon);
      <bibl>Shapiro 1993</bibl>, 64 n. 115; <bibl>Add2</bibl>, 364;
      <bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 3.289 s.v. Chrysippos 3 no. 1, pl. 228 (K. Schefold);
      <bibl>Hibbs 1961</bibl> 72, fig. 76; <bibl>Richter & Hall
      1936</bibl>, 201-202 no. 160, pls. 159, 176 (with previous bibliography).
Peitho, Pompe and Aphrodite attend Chrysippos
